page.title: 11Government
page.content: Local government consists of the Hampshire County Council, based in Winchester, the East Hampshire District Council, based in Petersfield, and the Whitehill Parish Council. Whitehill Parish Council looks after the interests and welfare of the local people. The East Hampshire District Council provides for refuse collection, hygiene, property development and planning. In 1985 there was an election, and the Liberal Party won the District Council from the Conservatives for the first time in many years. The Parish Council is still controlled by the Conservatives. The County Council keeps an eye on the District Council and also provides such things as educaion, the police, and better roads. by Mark Bruce
